snippet: The company owns roughly 60 percent of the newspaper market share and recent outlandish front pages depicting political leaders have some saying it holds too much political sway.
abstract: Critics say News Corporation's position as largest newspaper in Australia is giving it outsize role in country's politics; company owns roughly 60 percent of newspaper market share and  outlandish front pages depicting political leaders have some saying it holds too much political sway.
lead_paragraph: The company owns roughly 60 percent of the newspaper market share and recent outlandish front pages depicting political leaders have some saying it holds too much political sway.

headline.main: News Corp.’s Tight Grip on Australia’s Papers Shapes Its Politics
headline.print_headline: News Corp.’s Tight Grip on Australia’s Papers Shapes Its Politics
